author: jt.aussiegingersnap
title: Game Token Design [Revelar + Duo]
description: Stable & successful NFT gaming rewards and token models are largely unknown and often only reward a few players.

f6_assessments.q0:
This team presents an idea about developing a set of foundational math models that are freely available and that can be used to design tokens for new games using CNFTs, that can help to solve their problem within the challenge. 
The team provides 3 specific deliverable successes that will be used for game creators to develop their own game systems. All of them align with the challenge givens and I think that if this project success in that way, they will help to develop the gaming in Cardano ecosystem better. 
My advice for the team is that they should show some impacts that this project will make on Cardano community development. This will more convince to CA and also help them better align with this challenge settings.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has shown the detailed implementation plan for their idea, including the amount of time for each part of development, roadmap in weeks with milestones to develop the idea, and detail about how it works. These all can help we where their outlined budget addresses to and all reasonable. 
They also provide info on 2 key people in their team. 
But I wish that the team can provide some relevant risks that they can meet. This will help them make some plans for preventing the disruption on the implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal is completely enough basic elements for auditing, including a detailed roadmap with an achievable timeline, clear measurable goals. 
Lastly, their content about the problem and their solution is close enough to explain what they want to do. I hope that this idea will be successfully launched to help gaming industry moves faster.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about doing research and delivering a use case model about game token. Problems related to the development of game token rewards are clearly stated. This proposal has the potential to facilitate the integration of blockchain into new games by providing game developers with a better understanding of game token essential design criteria and a simulation tool. I strongly agree that this proposal addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The two team members are identified by their LinkedIN profile. They gather the relevant skills in research and computer science to give confidence in their ability to achieve proposal goals.
The detailed plan shows that the major directions of research are identified and understood. The roadmap/timeline shows that the team has a solid and constructive step by step approach. Considering that the job to be done and the proposal are crystal clear, and that the team shows evidence of the experience needed to complete the job, I strongly agree that this proposal is likely to be successful.
f6_assessments.q2:
Project deliverables are open-source publication about game token models and a simulation mechanism that will be made available on a public Github repository. A detailed timeline is given, from literature review to the final document publication. The budget breakdown is made from the forecast hours to be spend at each step of the project and a determined -reasonable- hourly rate.
For all these reasons, I consider that the community will be able to monitor accurately the progress of the project.

f6_assessments.q1: Proposers have a great and relevant experience and they shared enough information to validate it. Both proposers seems to have great technical skills which are needed to perform this proposal. Duo and Revelar, are both very relevant for the proposal and show the experience the proposers has in the area. The roadmap and timeline are detailed and seems reasonable. f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely Stable & successful NFT gaming rewards and token models are largely unknown and often only reward a few players.
  
This proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief beause it would do the development of a set of foundational math models that are freely available and that can be used to design tokens for new games using CNFTs

This proposal shows clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System by enabling gamers to create , exchange NFTs and govern the community of the specific game with ability to withdraw over time for real rewards.

Key metrics and goals of the proposal havent been stated clearly but implied metrics would be
  1. Number of unique projects who use the system and tokens

2. Number of assets created through our generator as NFTs

3. Mint day value (ADA) of CNFT's that contain assets created by our generator.

4 How many users are using these assets

5. How many exchanges happen daily

6 No Of users for each game in the community

7 what is the real value of the rewards.
 
Key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge. 

The proposal can be scaled to address future challenges  by bringing ne functionality.

This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system

f6_assessments.q2:
There is a clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
 
There are clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal such as
  
120 Hours: Literature and state-of-the-art review. (Completion -> Deliverable 1)

160 Hours : Development of the math modelling framework

80 Hours : Creation of a long-run simulation mechanism

40 Hours : Testing of the model and simulation framework using a use-case (Completion -> Deliverable 2)

80 Hours : Compiling the complete model and results into a document for open-source publication (Completion -> Deliverable 3)


 
 
There is a clear understandable description of the targeted problem
 
There is a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem
 
The proposer hasnt identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties

 
 
The proposer has no plan to deal with these difficulties
 
There are no contingency plans in place for various outcomes
